Package camzup.core

Class Face3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Face3
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Face3>, Iterable<Edge3>
public class Face3 extends Object implements Iterable<Edge3>, Comparable<Face3>
Organizes components of a 3D mesh into a list of vertices that form a face. This is not used by a mesh internally; it is created upon retrieval from a mesh.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final class 
    Face3.Edge3Iterator
    An iterator, which allows a face's edges to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
    static final class 
    Face3.Vert3Iterator
    An iterator, which allows a face's vertices to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.

    • set

      public Face3 set(Edge3... edges)
      Sets this face's vertices to refer to those in an array of edges. Assumes that each edge's origin matches the preceding edge's destination, and so only the origins need to be registered.
      Parameters:
      edges - the edges
      Returns:
      this face

    • translateGlobal

      public Face3 translateGlobal(Vec3 v)
      Translates all coordinates in a face by a vector; uses global coordinates, i.e., doesn't consider the face's orientation.
      Parameters:
      v - the vector
      Returns:
      this face
      See Also:
      • Vec3.add(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)

    • translateLocal

      public Face3 translateLocal(Vec3 v, Handedness handedness)
      Translates the face in local space. This is done by (1) finding the orientation of the face; (2) multiplying the input vector by the orientation; (3) subtracting the face's center point from the face's vertices; (4) adding the local vector; (5) then adding the center point.
      Parameters:
      v - the vector
      handedness - the handedness
      Returns:
      the face
      See Also:
      • orientation(Face3, Handedness, Transform3)
      • Transform3.mulDir(Transform3, Vec3, Vec3)
      • Vec3.add(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)
      • Vec3.sub(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)

      public Face3.Vert3Iterator vertIterator()

      Returns:
      the iterator

      public static Vec3[] sharedCoords(Face3 a, Face3 b)
